alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Jo Daviess (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 8:54PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Jo Daviess, Carroll, southwestern Stephenson, eastern Jackson and northeastern Clinton Counties through 945 PM CDT... At 854 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Miles, or 15 miles west of Mount Carroll, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Savanna around 900 PM CDT. Mount Carroll around 910 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Lanark, Pearl City and Shannon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for northwestern Illinois. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for east central Iowa.
